title: PM Modi Flags Off Pravasi Bharatiya Express, Says Future Is Not In War, It Is In Buddha - News18
summary:
PM Modi Flags Off Pravasi Bharatiya Express, Says Future Is Not In War, It Is In Buddha

Date: January 09, 2025

Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the 18th Pravasi Bharatiya Divas in Odisha, emphasizing the importance of the Indian diaspora and advocating for peace over conflict.

  • PM Modi highlighted that the Pravasi Bharatiya Divas serves to strengthen the connection between India and its overseas community.
  • The event is being organized by the Indian government in collaboration with the Odisha state government from January 8 to 10.
  • He noted the upcoming celebration of various festivals, linking them to the spirit of togetherness and celebration.
  • He reflected on Mahatma Gandhi's return to India in 1915, marking its significance in Indian history.
“Pravasi Bharatiya Divas has become an institution to strengthen the bond between India and its diaspora.” - PM Modi

PM Modi's speech at the Pravasi Bharatiya Divas reinforces the idea that fostering relationships with the diaspora is crucial for India’s future.
newTitle: PM Modi Inaugurates Pravasi Bharatiya Express, Advocates for Peace

72-year-old cancer patient in Bengaluru dies by suicide after being declined Ayushman Bharat scheme benefit: Report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bengaluru Cancer Patient Dies by Suicide After Denied Ayushman Bharat Benefits

Date: December 25, 2023

Source: Hindustan Times

A 72-year-old Bengaluru resident died by suicide after being declined coverage under the Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY) for treatment of gastric cancer.

  • The patient learned that he would not receive the promised ₹5 lakh benefit just 15 days after his cancer diagnosis.
  • The Kidwai Memorial Institute Of Oncology denied treatment benefits, citing that state government orders had not arrived.
  • Initial scans cost ₹20,000, and further chemotherapy sessions were planned.
  • The Karnataka government is yet to implement the AB PM-JAY senior citizen scheme.
“We planned on starting two rounds of chemo at Kidwai itself. We were ready to pay, but then we lost him to suicide in just two days.”

This tragic incident highlights the urgent need for better implementation of healthcare schemes to support vulnerable populations.
newTitle: Bengaluru Cancer Patient Dies by Suicide After Denied Ayushman Bharat Benefits

title: Elon Musk backs Sena (UBT) MP Priyanka Chaturvedi's ‘Pakistani grooming gang' post: 'True' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Elon Musk Supports MP Priyanka Chaturvedi's Statement on Pakistani Grooming Gangs

Publication Date: Jan 09, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Elon Musk has voiced his support for Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Priyanka Chaturvedi regarding her assertion about the use of the term 'Asian' in relation to grooming gangs predominately composed of men of Pakistani heritage in the UK.

  • Musk backed Chaturvedi's post asserting that these gangs should be identified as 'Pakistani grooming gangs'.
  • The controversy was ignited by UK PM Keir Starmer’s remarks surrounding a child sexual abuse scandal.
  • Chaturvedi criticized the broad categorization of 'Asian', asserting that it unfairly implicates all Asian communities.
  • The matter has spurred calls for a new inquiry into the incidents involving child exploitation in northern England.
  • Groups from the Indian diaspora in the UK have echoed Chaturvedi's calls for accuracy in identifying the perpetrators of these crimes.
“Repeat after me, they aren’t ASIAN Grooming Gangs but PAKISTANI grooming gangs,” said Priyanka Chaturvedi, to which Elon Musk replied ‘True’.

The discussion underscores the need for precise language in addressing sensitive social issues surrounding criminal activities and community reputation.
newTitle: Elon Musk Supports MP Priyanka Chaturvedi's Statement on Pakistani Grooming Gangs

summary:
The Hindu Morning Digest, January 9, 2024

Date: January 09, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

A stampede-like situation occurred while distributing Tirumala Srivari Vaikuntha Dwara Darshan tokens in Tirupati, leading to fatalities and injuries among devotees.

  • The Indian government plans to implement the Digital Personal Data Protection Rules by mid-2025.
  • WHO reports no unusual HMPV outbreak patterns from China.
  • India and the EU discuss commitments to human rights and freedom of expression.
  • India pledges support for Maldives' defense capabilities.
  • A tricolour flag is hoisted near the India-China border.
  • Foreign Secretary meets Taliban’s Foreign Minister in Dubai.
  • Supreme Court urges urgent implementation of the Dam Safety Act.
  • Donald Trump seeks to block his upcoming sentencing in New York.
  • Notable Indian poet Pritish Nandy passes away at 73.
  • SC directs framework for cashless medical treatment for road accident victims.
  • Four die in Tirupati stampede for Vaikunta Ekadasi tokens.
  • ISRO postpones satellite docking experiment again.
  • Finance Secretary takes on additional charge of the Revenue department ahead of the Union Budget.
  • India revises gold import data significantly.
  • Wildfires in Los Angeles lead to two fatalities and extensive evacuations.
“Four devotees, including a woman, died in the pushing and jostling witnessed at the makeshift counter...”

The events highlighted in the morning digest reflect significant political, social, and economic developments in India and abroad, showcasing a mix of challenges and initiatives influencing various sectors.

title: Shillong Teer Results Today, January 8, 2025 LIVE: Winning Numbers For Shillong Teer, Morning Teer, Juwai T - News18
summary:
Shillong Teer Results January 8, 2025 LIVE UPDATES

Publication Date: January 08, 2025, 22:14 IST Source: News18

The Shillong Teer lottery is organized daily, offering substantial financial prizes and promoting archery among the youth. Below are the winning numbers for January 8, 2025:

Winning Numbers for January 8, 2025

  • Shillong Teer: First Round: 61, Second Round: 88
  • Khanapara Teer: First Round: 28, Second Round: 99
  • Juwai Teer: First Round: 95, Second Round: 10
  • Shillong Morning Teer: First Round: 89, Second Round: 73

How to Play Shillong Lottery?

  1. The Teer game consists of two rounds, each lasting two minutes.
  2. Archers shoot arrows at a target, and participants guess the total number that hits.
  3. Winners can receive prizes based on their wagers.

For more information and details, participants should visit the official KHASI site.

‘Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4’: What Dr V Narayanan Said After Becoming New ISRO Chief - News18
summary:
Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4: What Dr V Narayanan Said After Becoming New ISRO Chief

Date: January 08, 2025 | Source: News18

Rocket Scientist Dr V Narayanan, recently appointed as the chief of ISRO, aims to leverage technology for enhancing the lives of Indians. His vision includes ambitious space missions such as Chandrayaan-4, Gaganyan, and Venus orbital missions.

  • Dr Narayanan emphasizes the importance of his new role, describing it as a “great responsibility.”
  • He expressed confidence in India’s upcoming space missions during an interview with CNN-News18.
  • Narayanan will officially take charge on January 14.
  • He has nearly four decades of experience in ISRO and holds a strong belief in teamwork.
  • His wife and daughter expressed immense pride in his new position.
“Basically, the country needs a lot of things in terms of climate studies, disaster management system, communication requirements, satellites for communication, and earth observation.” - Dr V Narayanan

Dr Narayanan's leadership is expected to continue pushing ISRO towards innovative solutions that benefit society, emphasizing quality of life for Indian citizens.
newTitle: Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4: Insights from New ISRO Chief Dr V Narayanan

title: AP Inter First-year Exam 2025 Cancelled, Only Second-year Exams From Now On - News18
summary:
AP Inter First-Year Exam 2025 Cancelled, Only Second-Year Exams Moving Forward

Date: January 08, 2025
Source: News18

The Board of Secondary Education, Andhra Pradesh (BSEAP) has made the significant decision to cancel the Intermediate first-year public examinations for 2025. This move is intended to alleviate the examination pressure on students, as only second-year public examinations will now be conducted.

  • The first-year syllabus will be taught in Telugu-English medium.
  • NCERT syllabus for Math and Chemistry for first-year students will be reduced significantly.
  • Internal assessments of 20 marks will replace annual exams for each subject.
  • Feedback from students, teachers, and stakeholders can be submitted until January 26.
  • AP SSC exams will be conducted from March 17 to 31, 2025.
  • AP inter second-year exams are scheduled between March 3 to March 20, 2025.
“To clear the exam this year, students needed to score at least 35 per cent in both theory and practical examinations,”

In conclusion, this significant change aims to reduce stress on students while adapting educational strategies to modern needs.
newTitle: AP Inter First-Year Exam 2025 Cancelled, Only Second-Year Exams Moving Forward

title: 6 killed, 30 injured in stampede in queue for event tokens at Tirupati temple - The Times of India
summary:
6 killed, 30 injured in stampede in queue for event tokens at Tirupati temple

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Local News

A tragic incident occurred at the Tirupati temple where a stampede resulted in the deaths of six individuals and injuries to thirty others while they were queuing for event tokens.

  • The stampede took place during a busy pilgrimage event.
  • Authorities are investigating the circumstances that led to the stampede.
  • The temple has expressed condolences to the families of the victims.
“This is a heartbreaking situation; our thoughts are with the families affected by this tragedy.” - Temple Official

This incident raises concerns about crowd management at large religious gatherings and highlights the need for improved safety measures.
newTitle: Tragic Stampede at Tirupati Temple Claims Six Lives and Leaves 30 Injured

Manipur CM says Meitei community's demand for ST status was 'cause' of ethnic conflict, diverts blame from govt - The New Indian Express
summary:
Manipur CM Blames Meitei Demand for ST Status for Ongoing Ethnic Conflict

Date: 08 Jan 2025

Source: IMPHAL

Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh addressed the ongoing ethnic violence in the state, attributing its cause to the Meitei community's demand for Scheduled Tribe (ST) status. He emphasized that his government is not to blame for the conflict that has displaced thousands since May 3, 2023.

  • The ethnic violence began on May 3, 2023, linked to the Meitei demand for ST status.
  • Singh asserted that the Manipur High Court had prompted the state to respond to the ST status demand, which was opposed by tribal bodies.
  • A rally by the All Tribal Students' Union led to violence, vandalism, and arson in Churachandpur district.
  • Over 250 people have been killed and thousands displaced due to the conflict.
  • The CM criticized the politicization of the situation and outlined government efforts to support those in relief camps.
  • Financial support benefiting education and other needs of displaced families was distributed by the CM.
“Now is not the time to seek popularity in social media and TV discussions.” - N Biren Singh

The state government continues to work on providing relief and education to those affected by the clashes, while the CM urged for a focus on the humanitarian crisis at hand.
newTitle: Manipur CM Blames Meitei Demand for ST Status for Ongoing Ethnic Conflict
